text: Wallace Joseph 'Jim' Schuback (1912-1965) was an Australian rugby league footballer who played in the 1930s and 1940s. Schuback was a tough front row forward from Bega, New South Wales who came to St. George to trial in early 1938 and was immediately signed by the club. His younger brother John Schuback also joined him to trial for the Saints, but was living out of the area, and ended up at Western Suburbs. Shcuback played three seasons with St. George and retired at the end of the 1940 NSWRFL season due to the war. Whiticker/Hudson "The Encyclopedia of Rugby League Players (1995 Ed) Daily News (Sydney) Jim Schuback photo 24/6/1940 https://trove.nla.gov.au/newspaper/article/236245178?searchTerm=%22jim%20schuback%22&searchLimits;=l-state=New+South+Wales Schuback died on 14 October 1965 at Maroubra, New South Wales.Sydney Morning Herald: Death Notice 15/10/1965 ==References== Category:St. George Dragons players Category:Australian rugby league players Category:Rugby league props Category:1912 births Category:1965 deaths Category:Rugby league players from New South Wales
